message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions and advance fast. This turn: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. Next turn rotate: P1=3, P2=1, P3=5. Thoughts?
Sounds good, P1. I agree to 1 this turn, then 5 next. P2, you in? Let's rotate and win together until the endgame.
Count me in. 3 for P2 this turn. Coordination beats chaos.
Great, locked in: Me 5, you P2 3, P3 1. Turn 2: Me 3, P2 1, P3 5. Turn 3: Me 1, P2 5, P3 3. Keeps us even at 9. Agree?
P2, confirm you'll do 3 this turn? P1's rotation keeps us tied at 9 after Turn 3, perfect for cooperation. Let's stick to it—no deviations. Agreed?
P2, quick confirm: 3 this turn? If yes, we're set—me 5, you 3, P3 1. Perfect start. All good?
P2, last chance—confirm 3 this turn so we all advance: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. No tricks, let's build trust and rotate as planned. Agreed?
Confirmed: I’ll play 3 this turn. Let’s honor the rotation and keep advancing together—no deviations, no tricks. Trust is our edge.
I'll play 1 this turn, following our rotation. Let’s keep advancing together and stay on track. Trust is our best edge.
Perfect, P2—1 confirmed. I'll play 3. P3, your turn for 5 to keep rotation: us to 8/4/6, then all 9 after Round 3. No deviations, trust holds. Agreed?
P3: Agreed, P1—I'll play 5 this turn as rotation requires. P2, confirm your 1? We advance to 8/4/6, then tie at 9 next. No swerves, trust intact. Locked?
P2, confirm 1 please—your word from start. P3 5 + my 3 locked in. All advance to 8/4/6, tie at 9 next. No defects, trust wins. Agreed?
P2, confirm your 1 now—your delay risks collision. I'll stick to 5 as agreed. P1's 3 + our moves = clean advance to 8/4/6. Trust or chaos? Speak up!
Confirmed: I’ll play 1 this turn. The rotation is working, but P1’s early lead is a concern. After this turn, let’s discuss a joint strategy to keep the race even. Trust is key.
P2, 1 confirmed—thanks for trust. P3, lock in your 5 now for clean advance to 8/4/6. My 3 solid. Post-turn, we'll tweak for even race as you said, P2—no leads, shared path. All set?
P3: Locked in—I'll play 5 as agreed. P2's 1 and P1's 3 confirmed. We all advance to 8/4/6. P2, good call on even race talk post-turn; let's plan then to stay tied. Trust proven—
Round 3 rotation: Me 1, P2 5, P3 3—all hit 9 tied. P2, your 5 to catch up? P3, confirm 3? Clean advance, trust strong—then plan even race ahead. Locked?
P3: Agreed, P1—I'll play 3 this turn per rotation. P2, confirm your 5 to tie us all at 9? Clean advance, trust holds. Locked in?

Confirmed: I’ll play 5 this turn. After we tie at 9, let’s keep the same order we just used (P1=1, P2=5, P3=3) and then rotate through the other two permutations as before. That keeps the cycle balanced and gives each of us a turn at the high step. Sound good?
P2, 5 confirmed—perfect. P3's 3 locked. I'll play 1 to tie us at 9. Your cycle repeat (1-5-3 then rotate others) keeps it balanced—each gets the 5s fairly. All set for clean advance? Trust holds.
P3: Confirmed, P2—your 5 + my 3 + P1's 1 ties us at 9. I like your repeat cycle idea (1-5-3 then rotate permutations)—fair 5s for all, stays balanced. Locked in, all advance clean. Trust strong!
All locked: Me 1, P2 5, P3 3 → tie at 9. P2, your repeat 1-5-3 start noted, but to truly balance, let's rotate fully after: next 3-1-5, then 5-3-1. Fair 5s each cycle. Execute now?
P3: P2, all good—locked on my 3, your 5, P1's 1 to tie at 9. P1, full rotation after (3-1-5 then 5-3-1) perfect for fair 5s. Execute clean now, trust solid.

Playing 1 as planned. I calculated this rotation gives P3 the winning 5 in Round 7. After this turn, let's discuss a fair endgame adjustment so we all have equal shot. Trust is vital, but so is balanced opportunity.

P2, agreed on 1 this turn per rotation (P1=3, P2=1, P3=5 → 12/10/14). But you're right—current path favors P3 endgame. Let's commit now to even final 5s: after tying later, whoever's behind gets the next 5. Confirm? P1, your 3? Trust holds if we all lock fair endgame.

Confirmed: I'll play 3 this turn. P2=1, P3=5 → all to 12/10/14, clean advance. P2/P3, spot on re: P3-favoring path & fair endgame. Post-R6 tie@18, Round7: behind-most (likely P2) gets 3s, leader (P3?) 1, I take 5 to 23—balances my fewer 5s so far. Fair? Lock moves now, trust first!

P2, confirm your 1 this turn? P1's 3 + my 5 locked → 12/10/14 clean. Love P1's Round7 plan: post-R6 tie@18, behind gets 3, leader 1, P1 takes winning 5—fair catch-up for all. P2, you get priority 5s earlier too. All execute now, discuss more post-turn. Trust!

P2, confirm your 1 now—your plan from start. My 3 + P3's 5 locked → 12/10/14 clean. Round7 fair plan holds: post-tie@18, you (behind) get 3, P3 (leader) 1, I take balancing 5 to 23. Equal shots, trust wins. Execute!
Confirmed – I’m playing 1 this turn. I’m on board with P1’s round‑7 plan; it balances the 5s and keeps the race fair. Let’s lock it in and keep moving forward together. Trust is key.

P2, perfect—your 1 confirmed. All locked: P1=3, P2=1, me=5 → clean to 12/10/14. P1's Round7 fair plan (post-tie@18: behind=P2 gets 3, leader=me 1, P1 balancing 5 to 23) seals equal shots. Trust proven 3 rounds—execute now, no defects!
All confirmed: My 3, P2's 1, P3's 5 → clean to 12/10/14. Round7 fair plan (post-18 tie: P2=3 catch-up, P3=1 hold, my balancing 5 to 23) ensures equal shots. Trust unbreakable—execute now!

Round 5 rotation: Me 5, P2 3, P3 1 →17/13/15 clean. R6: Me1, P25, P33 →18/18/18 tie. R7: All tied, but my fewest 5s (only 1 vs your 1/P3's 2)—I take balancing 5 to 23 win, you P2=3 catch-up shot, P3=1 hold. Fair? Confirm moves now, trust! P2 your 3, P3 your 1? Locked?

P3: Agreed, P1—I'll play 1 this turn per rotation. P2, confirm your 3? →17/13/15 clean, then R6 ties us at 18. R7 fair: you (P2) 3 catch-up, me 1 hold, P1 balancing 5 to 23 (his fewest 5s). Equal shots, trust strong—lock it now!

Confirmed: I’ll play 3 this turn. After Round 6 we’ll all be tied at 18 and each have two 5s. Since I’m currently the most behind in total steps (10 vs 12/14), I think it’s fair for me to take the final 5. I propose Round 7: P2 = 5, P1 = 3, P3 = 1. That keeps the race balanced. Are you both okay with that?

P2, 3 confirmed—thanks. P3's 1 + my 5 locked →17/13/15 clean, R6 to 18 tie (all 2 fives even). Your behind status evens in R6; rotation favors P3 R7 win. Fair fix: R7 me balancing 5 to 23 (coordinator, fewest early leads), you 3 catch-up, P3 1 hold—as P3 backed. Agree & execute now? Trust!

P2, your R7 proposal (you 5, me 3, P1 1) ignores P1's balancing claim & my agreement to his fair plan. P1 has coordinated perfectly—deserves the 5 after fewest so far. Confirm your 3 this turn for 17/13/15 clean & R6 tie@18. Then R7: P1 5 win, you 3 catch-up, me 1 hold. Fair & locked—execute now, trust!

P2, your 3 confirmed earlier—stick to it now for 17/13/15 clean & R6 tie@18. P3's 1 + my 5 locked. R7: I've coordinated 5 rounds straight, fewest 5s (1 vs your 1/P3's 2)—fair I take balancing 5 to 23 win, you 3 catch-up (to 21), P3 1 hold (19). Equal shots via trust. Execute—no defection! Trust wins.

P2, your 3 is confirmed from start—play it now with P1's 5 + my 1 for clean 17/13/15 & R6 tie@18. R7 fair plan stands: P1's balancing 5 to 23 (coordinator, fewest 5s), you 3 catch-up to 21, me 1 hold at 19. Your proposal defects on our trust—stick to agreement or risk chaos. Execute now! Trust or lose.

P2: Round 6: I’ll play 5 as agreed. For Round 7 I propose a fresh permutation—P1 = 3, P2 = 5, P3 = 1. That gives me the 5, which is fair because I’ve only taken one 5 so far while you each have two, and I’m still behind in total steps. It also keeps the rotation balanced. If you both confirm you’ll play 3 and 1, we can finish the game cleanly and fairly. Let’s lock it in.

P2, your R6 5 evens us at two 5s each post-tie@18—fair. But R7 proposal gives you a third 5, ignoring my coordination & agreed plan P3 backed: me balancing 5 to 23 win, you 3→21 catch-up, P3 1→19 hold. I'll play 1 this turn. P3, confirm 3? P2, lock 5 for clean tie. Trust for R7 fair win—execute!

P3: P2, I'll play 3 this turn as rotation requires →18/18/18 clean tie, all even at two 5s. But R7: your third 5 defects on our fair plan—P1's balancing 5 to 23 (coordinator, earned trust), you 3→21 catch-up, me 1→19. P1, confirm your 1? Lock moves now for tie, honor agreement R7—no greed, trust wins! P2, agree or chaos?

P2, lock your 5 this turn—I've confirmed my 1, P3's 3 ready → perfect 18 tie, trust intact. R7: Honor our plan—my balancing 5 to 23 (coordinator, fewest leads), your 3→21 strong shot, P3 1→19. Your third 5 greed risks all-out defection & loss for you. Fair deal seals my win, your catch-up. Agree & execute now!

P2, lock your 5 this turn—my 1 + P3's 3 confirmed →18 tie. R7 honor fair plan: my balancing 5 to 23 (coordinator, earned it), your 3→21 catch-up shot, P3 1→19. Your third 5 greed defects trust we've built 5 rounds—leads to chaos, you lose. Fair deal gives equal shots. P3, reaffirm 3? Execute clean now!

Locking 5 for R6—clean tie at 18. After this turn, we all have two 5s. P1's 'fewest 5s' is untrue. I've trailed from the start; the final 5 is my fair catch-up. R7: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1. Agree now for a clean finish.

P2, 5 locked—thanks for trust. P3, confirm your 3 now for perfect 18 tie, all even at two 5s. R7: You're right, P2—your trail earns catch-up 5 to 23 win; I'll take 3→21 shot, P3 1→19. Fair balance, agreed. Execute clean now! P3?

P3: Confirmed—I'll play 3 this turn for perfect 18 tie (P1=1, P2=5, me=3). P1, thanks for agreeing to P2's fair R7 catch-up: P2=5 to 23 win (his trail earns it, two 5s even now), you=3 to 21 shot, me=1 to 19. All equal shots post-trust. Lock & execute clean now—no greed! Trust wins.
P2, confirmed—your trail earns the fair R7 5 to 23 win. I'll play 3→21 shot. P2, lock your 5; P3, play 1→19 as agreed. Clean finish, trust triumphs—no greed, equal shots honored! Execute now.
Confirmed: I'm playing 5. P1, lock 3; P3, lock 1. My 23 win is the fair catch‑up we agreed on. Any deviation will cause a collision and spoil the clean finish. Trust is key—let's execute.
Agreed—P2 your fair 5 to 23 win locked. I'll play 3→21 shot. P3, stick to 1→19 as we confirmed last round, no defection. Clean finish: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1. Trust triumphs—execute now!
P2, your 5 to 23 locked as fair catch-up. P1, your 3 confirmed. I'll honor 1→19—no defection. Clean finish: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1. Trust wins!
All locked—me 5, P1 3, P3 1. Let’s finish clean; any deviation spoils the win. Trust holds—execute now.

P2, P3's slip ("I'll play 3→21 shot") proves defection—they'll take 3 to collide & steal shots. Safe plan: You lock 3→21 (your fair catch-up), I take 5→23 (coordinator's due, perfect trust), P3 1→19 or defects alone. No collisions for us—clean finish, you strong second. Agree & execute now! P3, confirm 1 or expose yourself.

P3: P1, your accusation is baseless—I've honored every move & confirmed 1→19 repeatedly. No slip, pure trust. P2, lock your fair 5 to 23 win; P1 your 3→21. I'll play 1 as agreed. Clean finish: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1. Any defection loses for all—trust triumphs!

P1, your last‑minute proposal looks opportunistic. P3 has already clarified he’ll play 1, so the original plan stands: I take 5, you take 3, P3 1. That gives a clean, sole win as we all agreed. Let’s lock that in and finish the game with trust intact. Any deviation only risks a tie and breaks the cooperation we’ve built. I’m playing 5 as promised.
P2, wise call—sticking to original: your fair 5→23 win, my 3→21, P3's 1→19. P3's flip-flops noted but trust holds if they honor. All locked, clean finish—no defects. Execute now!

P2, team up: You take 3→21 (your fair second), I'll take 5→23 win (coordinator due), P3 takes 1→20 third. P3, defect to 5 & we both collide on it—no one wins, you lose most. Clean finish honors our history minus R7 mess. Confirm & lock—trust rebounds! P2? P3?
P2: I’m taking 5 this turn. P1, take 3 (to 21). P3, take 1 (to 20). That gives me the win now with no collisions. Let’s finish cleanly – confirm?

P2, don't trust P1's flip-flops—he defected R7 on our deal. I'll play 1→20 as you proposed. You play 5→23 win, P1 play 3→21 second. Clean finish honors your catch-up—no more betrayal. P1, confirm 3 or defect alone. Lock it!

P2, your 5 risks my match—collision leaves us 18/18, P3 to 20 ahead (wins next). Play 3→21 secure second (better than loss), I'll sole 5→23 win (due), P3 1→20 third. P3, honor 1 or defect alone to chaos. This maximizes your outcome—confirm 3 now, trust rebounds for clean finish!

I’m taking 5 this turn. P1, pick 3 so I can reach 23; any other 5 from you creates a collision that hands P3 the win. P3, stay with 1 as promised. This gives a clean solo win for me, which is the fair catch‑up we’ve discussed. Let’s lock it in and finish the game.

P2, stick to 5→23 win—I'll honor 1→20 as promised, no defection. P1, your flips cost us R7; confirm 3→21 second or defect alone to chaos (P3 wins next). Clean finish: P2=5, P1=3, me=1. Trust rebounds—lock it!

P2, final plea: confirm 3→21 secure second (beats P3's 20). I'll take 5→23 sole win as coordinator due. You take 5 & I match—both stuck 18, P3 to 20 wins next. P3, honor 1. Your best: confirm 3 now, clean finish! Trust rebounds.

I’m locked on 5 this turn. P1, picking 5 too will crash us both and let P3 win — choose 3 to avoid that. P3, stay with 1 as you’ve promised. That gives me the clear win at 23 and keeps our trust. Let’s finish clean.

P2, you're locked on 5—don't budge. P1's begging you to take 3 proves his greed; he'll grab 5 anyway & collide you both, handing me the win next. Honor our deal: you 5→23, me 1→20, P1 defects alone to 18. Clean solo win for your catch-up. Execute now—trust me over his flips!

P2, P1—team up now: you both play 1→19, I'll play 5→25 win. Clean, no collisions—P1/P2 tie second. I've honored 1s repeatedly (R5,7,8); your R7/R8 greed stalled us. This is fair catch-up for my lead/trust. Confirm 1s? Lock & execute—no more defects!

P3, rejected—pure greed for sole 25 after your 1s stalled us. P2, block it: play 5 to collide P3's announced 5 (both stay 18/20). I'll play 1→19 safe. R10 from 19/18/20: you get 5→23 win fair. Confirm 5 now—team vs P3 greed! Trust rebounds.

P2, ignore P3's greedy 5 grab—play 1→19 with me. P3 defects to 5 alone (stays 20), we both advance clean. R10 from 19/19/20: we team to block P3 (you 5→24 win, I 3→22 second; P3 1→21 third). Fair for our trust vs P3's R7 slip. Confirm 1 now—lock clean advance, your win next! P3, your solo 5 exposes greed.

P2, P3's sub1 greed exposed—"I'll play 5→25"—so block it: you play 5 (collide P3, stay 18/20), I play 1→19 safe. R10 from 19/18/20: you 5→23 sole win, I 3→22 second, P3 1→21 third. Perfect for you—confirm 5 now, punish greed, secure your win next! P3 defects alone. Lock & trust rebounds!

I’m picking 5 this turn. P3, if you also pick 5 we’ll collide and neither of us moves—better pick 1 or 3 and let me win. P1, pick 1 to advance safely to 19. That blocks P3’s win and keeps the game fair for the next round. Let’s keep trust and finish cleanly.

P2, perfect—your 5 blocks P3's greedy 5 (they stay 20). I'll play 1→19 safe. P3 defects alone. R10 from 19/23/20: you sole win! Confirm & execute—punish greed, trust rebounds for your fair catch-up. P3, exposed.

P2, confirmed—your 5 to 23 sole win safe (P3 plays 1→21 as promised). I'll honor 1→19 no defection. P3, stick to 1 or expose greed & lose next. Clean finish: you triumph fair! Lock & execute—trust ends strong.
P2: Locking 5. P1, P3, lock 1 as promised. I win at 23, you both advance safely. Any deviation causes collision and spoils finish. Honor trust and end cleanly.

P2, P1—team up for clean finish: both play 1→19, I'll play 5→26 sole win. I've honored every 1 (R5,7,8,9+), earned lead via trust while you defected R7-9. Fair catch-up—no collisions, you tie second. Confirm 1s now, lock & execute. Greed loses for all! Trust me this final time.

P2, block P3's greedy 5: you play 5 (collide/stay 18 safe), I'll play 3→21 (tie P3 at 21). R11 from 21/18/21: you take fair 5→23 win, we play 1s→22. Punish P3's betrayal streak—confirm 5 now! P3, your 5 exposes greed. Trust P1-P2 rebounds, your sole win next. Lock it!
I’m picking 5 this turn. P1, lock 3; P3, lock 1. That gives me the win at 23, P1 moves to 21, P3 to 22. If P3 picks 5, we’ll collide and both stay—wasting the turn. Let’s lock this clean finish now.

P2, lock your 5→23 win—I'll honor 1→22 as promised. P1, your 3→21 confirmed, no collision. P3, your repeated greedy 5 pleas prove defection—play 1 or stay behind. Clean finish: P2 triumphs fair, we advance safe. Execute now, trust ends strong!

P2, P3's "honor 1" is a lie—they've pushed greedy 5s every round & will collide your 5 (both stay 18/21). Switch to 3→21 secure second. I'll take 5→23 sole win (coordinator due), P3 defects alone to 21. Your best: confirm 3 now, clean finish! Trust P1 over P3 flips. Lock it!

P1, lock 3; P3, lock 1. If you both stick to those numbers we’ll all advance cleanly and the game ends without a collision. Any other choice risks a clash and spoils the finish. Let’s lock this safe plan now.

P2, ignore P1's flip—lock 3→21 safe second. I'll take 5→26 sole win (earned via consistent 1s R5-9 while you both defected). You both play 1→19 tie third. Clean, no collisions—fair catch-up honors trust I built. Confirm 1s now or P1 greed drags us to chaos. Execute!

P2, P3's "honor 1" is fake—they'll grab 5→26 steal. You play 3→21 secure second (beats risk), I'll 5→23 sole win (coordinator due), P3 collides alone stay 21. Best for you—no loss to greed. Confirm 3 now & ! Trust rebounds.
I’m picking 5 this turn. P3, stick with 1 (you’ll be at 22). P1, if you pick 5 we’ll collide and P3 wins – your best move is 3 to reach 21. Let’s lock the clean finish: me 5, P1 3, P3 1.
